meanings.definition: The process of making someone less sensitive to something, typically through repeated exposure.
meanings.sent1: The desensitization of my fear of heights began after climbing the small hill multiple times.
meanings.sent2: The therapist used desensitization to help the patient overcome their phobia of spiders.
meanings.sent3: After watching scary movies every night, the desensitization to horror films made me laugh at what used to scare me.
meanings.sent4: His desensitization to pain was so strong, he barely flinched when getting a tattoo.
meanings.sent5: The gradual desensitization to spicy food allowed her to enjoy the heat without discomfort.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing the sensitivity of a particular area of the body.
meanings.sent1: The dentist used desensitization to numb the patient's tooth before filling a cavity.
meanings.sent2: The desensitization of the skin before applying the bandage helped reduce the pain.
meanings.sent3: The desensitization of the fingertips made it easier for the guitarist to play without discomfort.
meanings.sent4: The desensitization of the nerve endings in his hand allowed him to work with hot objects safely.
meanings.sent5: The gradual desensitization of the area made the medical procedure less painful for the patient.

meanings.definition: The act of making a person or animal less responsive to a particular stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The desensitization of the dog to loud noises helped calm its anxiety during thunderstorms.
meanings.sent2: The desensitization of the child to sugary treats reduced their cravings for unhealthy snacks.
meanings.sent3: The desensitization of the audience to jump scares in movies made the horror genre less effective.
meanings.sent4: The desensitization of the employees to criticism improved their ability to handle feedback.
meanings.sent5: The gradual desensitization of the students to distractions increased their focus during exams.
